meanings.definition: To drink more alcohol than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outdrink her friends at parties.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outdrink his buddies during the game.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, she jokingly challenged her brother to outdrink her in lemonade.
meanings.sent4: The champion outdrinks all his competitors with ease.
meanings.sent5: In the drinking contest, he proved he could outdrink anyone in town.

meanings.sent1: They decided to outdrink each other to see who could handle more shots.
meanings.sent2: She always outdrinks her colleagues at the office happy hours.
meanings.sent3: The two friends playfully compete to outdrink one another at the bar.
meanings.sent4: He outdrinks everyone at the pub, earning the title of the local drinking champion.
meanings.sent5: During the party, he attempted to outdrink the host and ended up winning a bet.
